result.execSummary:
The defendant Matthew A. King was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Manuf/Deliver Cocaine (>5-15g) [Modifiers: Party to a Crime], a class E felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(cm)2.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Pay all applicable mandatory surcharges, fees, assessments and costs.  All financial obligations  to be paid through collection by DOC from 25% of prison funds and as a condition of Extended Supervision.  Any remaining balance to paid  by end of supervision or to convert to a civil judgment.

superMiscConds.notes:
No use or possession of illegal substances.
No conduct rising to the level of probable cause that a violation of criminal law has been committed.
Obtain AODA assessment. Complete follow up care/treatment.  Cooperate with random urine screens.

supervisions.notes:
Provide a DNA sample, pay surcharge.
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm; and that his voting rights are suspended and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Matthew A. King

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: No reply from defendant or surety.  sb
Defendant's Bail Forfeiture Notice returned undeliverable.
Notice of bond forfeiture mailed to defendant; Original in file. ($200.00) gj
Original Transcript of SENTENCING HEARING (19 pages) commencing 09/09/2015 received and filed.

Defendant Matthew A. King in court with attorney Valeria Lenise Taylor.  Defendant Matthew A. King in custody.  
David Robles appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: dds.

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements made by State and defense.  Due to the lateness of the hour (12pm) case passed until 1:30 p.m.
Defendant is remanded for sentencing.

Attorney Valeria Lenise Taylor in court, defendant Matthew A. King not in court, in custody.  David Robles appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Attorney Taylor has just been appointed.  Defendant was picked up on a warrant.  Arguments made as to bail.  Defendant is remanded for sentencing.  Court advised parties that as of August 3, 2015, this case will be reassigned to Judge Daniel Konkol, Branch 44 in Room 316 of the Safety Building.  Case adjourned for sentencing on 9/9/2015 at 8:30 am, branch 44.  aw  Sentencing hearing scheduled for September 9, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Notice of Motion and Motion to Reduce Bail

Defendant was picked up on a warrant.  Court contacted public defender's office to have him reevaluated and new counsel appointed.   Case adjourned for return on warrant on 6/11/2015 at 8:30 am, branch 3.  aw

Attorney Joseph R. Reback in court.  David Robles appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant not in court.  
Case scheduled for sentencing today.  Defendant did not appear.  Case remains in warrant status.  aw
Original Transcript  PLEA HEARING (13 pages) commencing AUGUST 25, 2014 received and filed.
Justice Point discharge summary report, received and filed.  aw
Cash bond ordered to be forfeited in the amount of 200.00.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE JUDGE ON RETURN OF THE BENCH WARRANT.

Attorney Joseph R. Reback appears by phone.  Dennis P. Murphy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
NO FILE IN COURT.
Defendant tested postive for cocaine, and wanted to challenge the test.  Defendant did not have enough money, and stated his girlfriend had the money.  Defendant went to get the money and then left.  Defendant did not return.  Court orders a bench warrant.  Attorney Reback can bring in the defendant on Monday morning to address.  aw
Justice Point Violation report, received and filed.  aw
Court addresses violation report dated 9/10/2014.  Court takes no action as defendant has reported to Justice Point, and was drug tested.  aw
Justice Point Pretrial Services Violation Report received and filed due to missed office contact.  aw

Defendant Matthew A. King in court with attorney Joseph R. Reback.  David Robles appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
BRANCH 22 FOR BRANCH 3.  Case in court for final pre-trial, defense wishes to move forward with a plea.
Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.    
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm.  Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.  Case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 3.  Jury trial calendared on 09/29/2014 is ordered vacated.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for November 14, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

14RM040219  Actual Date Bond Posted with Sheriff:
08/19/2014
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.  aw

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for ENHANCEDSupervision.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY  to be monitored by drug testing.  Court orders defendant to not use or possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription.

Defendant Matthew A. King in court with attorney Joseph R. Reback.  David Robles appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case adjourned for final pretrial on 8/25/2014 at 1:30 pm, branch 3.
Court addressed violation report dated today.  Defendant did not pay the $25.00 case to have sample retested.  Court modifies bail.  Defendant taken into custody.  aw  Final pre-trial scheduled for August 25, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
JUSTICE POINT Pretrial Services Violation Report received and filed.    hgj

Defendant Matthew A. King in court.  Randy P. Sitzberger appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  ENTRY MADE WITHOUT THE COURT FILE.  Present in court is Justice Point ELISE JOSEPHSON.  Case in court due to violation.  Arguments heard as to bail.  Court admonishes Defendant.  Defendant has prior to his 8/18/2014 court appearance to pay $25 to challenge results.  If he doesn't meet that deadline his violation can be addressed at his Scheduling Conference before Judge Fiorenza.  No action taken at this time.  Case remains calendared for SCHEDULING on AUGUST 18, 2014 AT 8:30 in Branch 03.

Defendant Matthew A. King in court with attorney Joseph R. Reback.  David Robles appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case scheduled for plea and sentencing.  Defendant does not want to enter a plea at this time.  Case adjourned for scheduling conference on 8/18/2014 at 8:30 am, and for jury trial on 9/29/2014 at 8:30 am, branch 3.  Court reminds defendant to not use or possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription.  aw  Scheduling conference scheduled for August 18, 2014 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for September 29, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Justice Point Pretrial Services Report received and filed.  aw

Defendant Matthew A. King in court with attorney Joseph R. Reback.  David Robles appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case scheduled for final pretrial.  Defendant would like to resolve the case.  Case adjourned for plea and sentencing on 7/21/2014 at 8:30 am, branch 3.  aw  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for July 21, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Matthew A. King in court with attorney Joseph R Reback.  David Robles appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defense counsel has no motion to be filed, and requests case set for trial.  Case adjourned for final pretrial on 7/7/2014 at 8:30 am, and for jury trial on 8/18/2014 at 8:30 am, branch 3. Filed, signed Felony Pretrial Scheduling Order.  Court reminds defendant to not use or possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription.  Court orders all final pretrial documents filed by the next court date.  aw  Final pre-trial scheduled for July 7, 2014 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for August 18, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Justice Point Pretrial Services Report received and filed.  aw

Defendant Matthew A. King in court with attorney Joseph R Reback.  David Robles appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defense counsel is not able to open a disk, and needs time to go over discovery with client.  Case adjourned for scheduling conference on 5/19/2014 at 1:30 pm, branch 3.  Court ordered all motions be filed by the next court date.  Court reminds defendant that next test to be negative.  aw  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 19, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
Justice Point Pretrial Services Report received and filed.  aw

Defendant Matthew A. King in court with attorney Joseph R Reback.  David Robles appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Fiorenza, Branch 03.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant plead not guilty.  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 5, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY  to be monitored by drug testing and portable breathalyzers.
   No use or possession of illegal or controlled substances without a valid prescription and no drug paraphernalia.
    No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.
  Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.

Defendant Matthew A. King in court with attorney Mary D Scholle.  Defendant Matthew A. King in custody.  Molly M Schmidt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Fiorenza, Branch 03.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  
DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 22, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
